info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 10:38PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Fulton and west central Saratoga Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1037 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Caroga Lake Public Campground, or near Gloversville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Johnstown, Broadalbin, Hagaman, Mayfield, Galway, Cranberry Creek, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Northampton Beach Public Campground, Caroga Lake, Mount Pleasant, Perth, Berkshire, Bleecker, Parkis Mills, Meco, West Perth, Munsonville, Sweets Crossing and Shaw Corners. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
